data.author: 10gordon10
data.content: RNS 8934N This RNS is a TR‑1 “Standard Form for Notification of Major Holdings” filed by Supernova Digital Assets plc (and also reporting for Roundhouse Digital Pte Ltd). It is not an announcement of a sale, but a reporting of shareholdings and changes in voting rights as required under FCA disclosure rules. The TR‑1 confirms: Supernova Digital Assets plc holds 76,332,000 ordinary shares in Satsuma Technology PLC with 0.68 % of voting rights The RNS ticked “an event changing the breakdown of voting rights” — not “an acquisition or disposal of voting rights” — indicating the change came from the overall share structure (dilution) rather than a direct transaction. The same RNS also shows Roundhouse Digital Pte Ltd reported a new position of 75,000,000 ordinary shares (0.67 %). It listed the previous notification as 16.53 %, meaning Roundhouse dramatically lost voting rights — again consistent with share issuance/dilution rather than just sales on the market. The change in percentage (to 0.68 %) reflects a change in the share register and total shares outstanding, likely because of the large share issuance from convertible loan note conversion and Main Market uplisting in December 2025.

data.content: Always read the small print: As announced on 11 December 2025, the Company holds approximately £90.0 million in cash. data.author: 10gordon10
data.content: RNS 8934N This RNS is a TR‑1 “Standard Form for Notification of Major Holdings” filed by Supernova Digital Assets plc (and also reporting for Roundhouse Digital Pte Ltd). It is not an announcement of a sale, but a reporting of shareholdings and changes in voting rights as required under FCA disclosure rules. The TR‑1 confirms: Supernova Digital Assets plc holds 76,332,000 ordinary shares in Satsuma Technology PLC with 0.68 % of voting rights The RNS ticked “an event changing the breakdown of voting rights” — not “an acquisition or disposal of voting rights” — indicating the change came from the overall share structure (dilution) rather than a direct transaction. The same RNS also shows Roundhouse Digital Pte Ltd reported a new position of 75,000,000 ordinary shares (0.67 %). It listed the previous notification as 16.53 %, meaning Roundhouse dramatically lost voting rights — again consistent with share issuance/dilution rather than just sales on the market. The change in percentage (to 0.68 %) reflects a change in the share register and total shares outstanding, likely because of the large share issuance from convertible loan note conversion and Main Market uplisting in December 2025.

data.author: 10gordon10
data.content: RNS 8934N This RNS is a TR‑1 “Standard Form for Notification of Major Holdings” filed by Supernova Digital Assets plc (and also reporting for Roundhouse Digital Pte Ltd). It is not an announcement of a sale, but a reporting of shareholdings and changes in voting rights as required under FCA disclosure rules. The TR‑1 confirms: Supernova Digital Assets plc holds 76,332,000 ordinary shares in Satsuma Technology PLC with 0.68 % of voting rights The RNS ticked “an event changing the breakdown of voting rights” — not “an acquisition or disposal of voting rights” — indicating the change came from the overall share structure (dilution) rather than a direct transaction. The same RNS also shows Roundhouse Digital Pte Ltd reported a new position of 75,000,000 ordinary shares (0.67 %). It listed the previous notification as 16.53 %, meaning Roundhouse dramatically lost voting rights — again consistent with share issuance/dilution rather than just sales on the market. The change in percentage (to 0.68 %) reflects a change in the share register and total shares outstanding, likely because of the large share issuance from convertible loan note conversion and Main Market uplisting in December 2025.

data.content: Always read the small print: As announced on 11 December 2025, the Company holds approximately £90.0 million in cash. The asset base of the Company will therefore be approximately £52.3 million. So reasonably well priced already based on the volatility of bitcoin.

data.author: Sieveco
data.content: Come on Buzzcoin! I am as bullish as anyone at this level. The mcap is well below the combined cash and bitcoin holdings of the company. However, don't insult people by posting indicating that the company holds £90 million in cash, when we all know that the company holds £11 million, having used the rest to get rid of its debt. I mean this was RNS'd a couple of weeks ago. Fair value here is about 50. Higher if BTC continues to rise.
